did.unittitle: Mollie Siegel Collection on Anti-Nuclear and Peace Movement Activism
did.abstract: Mollie Siegel (1918-2011) was a California activist and nurse involved in the Nuclear Freeze campaign, anti-war movements, and other progressive social movements in the mid- and late 20th century. The Mollie Siegel Collection on Anti-Nuclear and Peace Movement Activism (dated 1957-1999) consists of materials created and collected by Siegel documenting her organizing work in the peace and anti-nuclear movements in California. The bulk of the collection consists of pamphlets, flyers for actions, newsletters, reading lists, and reports, many of which had been initially laid into a scrapbook. The collection also contains handwritten notes, copies of letters Siegel received from elected representatives, and a copy of the cookbook Peace De Resistance. Major topics present in this collection include the American military budget, the Nuclear Freeze campaign, international arms agreements, and peace activism, with particular emphasis on opposition to American involvement in the Vietnam War and the Gulf War. The activities of South Bay Citizens for Peace are particularly well represented. In addition to the specific movements documented in this collection, these materials also reflect the activism of this period through Siegel's perspective as a woman.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in an archival box and folders in their existing order. Materials were described on the collection-level with a folder-list.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Some of the ephemera in this collection had been initially laid into a scrapbook. The exterior of the original scrapbook was not included in this collection due to its physical condition and the lack of contextual information it provided.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mollie Siegel (1918-2011) was a California activist and nurse involved in the Nuclear Freeze campaign, anti-war movements, and other progressive social movements in the mid- and late 20th century. She was particularly active with Women's Strike for Peace, SANE-Nuclear Freeze, and the Nation Associates.
